ProjectTitle: PROGENITOR: PRobing the OriGin of black holes through spectral moNITORing
InitialFeedbackHistory:
15/07/2022
2. Data: observational data from archives are considered existing data, you can indicate that you are both reusing and generating data. 
3. 3rd party restrictions: are there any restrictions using or sharing the data from the archives? Do you access these via a Data Transfer Agreement or is there a licence for this data? 
4.  Metadata: The archives where you find your data are likely using metadata according to a standard, take a look if you can find this information when working with this data, you can add this to your final DMP which FWO expects at the end of your fellowship.
7. Sharing: have you considered which repository to use for the data that you will generate? If there is a suitable disciplinary repository that may be the best place to share and preserve your data, you can also use KU Leuven RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr)
label: good with suggestions
